bioshift.fileio package¶

Submodules¶

bioshift.fileio.azara module¶

class bioshift.fileio.azara.AzaraDataSource(path: Path, params: SpectrumParams)¶

Bases: SpectrumDataSource

Concrete implementation of SpectrumDataSource for reading data from Azara .spc files.

params¶

Spectrum parameters used to determine how to read the data.

Type:

bioshift.core.spectrumparams.SpectrumParams

memmap¶

Memory map of the file on disk.

Type:

numpy.memmap

get_block_index(idx: tuple[int, ...]) → int¶

Takes an ND coordinate index vector and converts it to the linear index of the block within the file.

Parameters:

idx – ND index of the block

Returns:

Corresponding linear block index.

memmap: memmap¶
params: SpectrumParams¶
read_block(index: int) → ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶

Read a single block from the data file, at the given linear index.

Parameters:

index – Linear index of the block being read in the data file.

Returns:

N-dimensional array containing the spectrum values within the block.

Return type:

NDArray

class bioshift.fileio.azara.AzaraSpectrumReader(par_path: Path, spc_path: Path)¶

Bases: SpectrumReader

Implementation of SpectrumReader for Azara spectra stored in .par and .spc file pairs.

par_path¶

Path to the .par file.

Type:

pathlib.Path

spc_path¶

Path to the .spc file.

Type:

pathlib.Path

classmethod can_read(path: Path) → bool¶

Used to determine whether a particular spectrum path should be read using an AzaraSpectrumReader.

Returns:

True if the provided path is a .spc or .par file.

classmethod from_path(path: Path) → AzaraSpectrumReader¶

Creates an instance of AzaraSpectrumReader from a given .spc or .par path. Given a .par file it will find the corresponding .spc and vice-versa.

Returns:

Instance of AzaraSpectrumReader supplied with paths for both the .spc and .par files.

get_data() → AzaraDataSource¶

Create an AzaraDataSource object for the new spectrum.

Returns:

AzaraDataSource object.

get_params() → SpectrumParams¶

Read the spectrum metadata from the .par file.

Returns:

SpectrumParams object.

classmethod par_from_spc(spc_path: Path) → Path¶

Finds a corresponding .par file from a .spc file. Given spectrum.spc, checks spectrum.spc.par and spectrum.par.

Parameters:

spc_path – Path to the .spc file.

Returns:

Path to a .par file.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – if a .par file can not be found

par_path: Path¶
classmethod parse_par_file(par_path: Path) → list[tuple[str]]¶
classmethod spc_from_par(par_path: Path) → Path¶

Finds a corresponding .spc file from a .par file. First checks for a .spc file specified in the .par file, failing that checks for a .spc with a matching name.

Parameters:

par_path – Path to the .par file.

Returns:

Path to a .spc file.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – if a .spc file can not be found

spc_path: Path¶

bioshift.fileio.loadspectrum module¶

bioshift.fileio.loadspectrum.load_spectrum(path: str | PathLike) → Spectrum¶

Helper function to dynamically dispatch a concrete SpectrumReader to read a spectrum from a path.

Parameters:

path – Path to spectrum on disk.

Returns:

Spectrum loaded from the path.

bioshift.fileio.nmrpipe module¶

class bioshift.fileio.nmrpipe.NMRPipeSpectrumReader(path: Path)¶

Bases: SpectrumReader

classmethod can_read(path: Path) → bool¶

Specifies whether or not a given path can be read by a particular concrete SpectrumReader implementation. Used to dynamically determine which concrete SpectrumReader to use to read from a given path.

Returns:

True if the given path can be read by the concrete SpectrumReader class.

classmethod from_path(path: Path) → NMRPipeSpectrumReader¶
get_data() → SpectrumDataSource¶

Creates a SpectrumDataSource object for the spectrum.

Returns:

SpectrumDataSource object which reads raw spectrum array from disk.

get_params() → SpectrumParams¶

Creates a SpectrumParams object for the spectrum.

Returns:

SpectrumParams object containing metadata read from path.

bioshift.fileio.spectrumdatasource module¶

class bioshift.fileio.spectrumdatasource.SpectrumDataSource¶

Bases: ABC

Class which lazily reads raw spectrum data.

cache¶

Stores a cache of the raw spectrum array after it is loaded.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

cache: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
get_data() → ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶

Checks if the data is in the cache, and loads it if not.

Returns:

Raw spectrum data array.

bioshift.fileio.spectrumreader module¶

class bioshift.fileio.spectrumreader.SpectrumReader(path: Path)¶

Bases: ABC

Base class for spectrum readers. Specifies an interface for producing a SpectrumParams and a SpectrumDataSource from different file formats implemented by concrete SpectrumReaders.

abstractmethod classmethod can_read(path: Path) → bool¶

Specifies whether or not a given path can be read by a particular concrete SpectrumReader implementation. Used to dynamically determine which concrete SpectrumReader to use to read from a given path.

Returns:

True if the given path can be read by the concrete SpectrumReader class.

abstractmethod classmethod from_path(path: Path)¶
abstractmethod get_data() → SpectrumDataSource¶

Creates a SpectrumDataSource object for the spectrum.

Returns:

SpectrumDataSource object which reads raw spectrum array from disk.

abstractmethod get_params() → SpectrumParams¶

Creates a SpectrumParams object for the spectrum.

Returns:

SpectrumParams object containing metadata read from path.

read() → Spectrum¶

Creates a new spectrum from a SpectrumParams and SpectrumDataSource constructed by reading from self.path.

Returns:

New spectrum object.

bioshift.fileio.ucsf module¶

class bioshift.fileio.ucsf.UCSFDataSource(path: Path, params: SpectrumParams)¶

Bases: SpectrumDataSource

Concrete implementation of SpectrumDataSource for reading data from .ucsf files.

params¶

Spectrum parameters used to determine how to read the data.

memmap¶

Memory map of the file on disk.

get_block_index(idx: tuple[int, ...]) → int¶

Takes an ND coordinate index vector and converts it to the linear index of the block within the file.

Parameters:

idx – ND index of the block

Returns:

Corresponding linear block index.

read_block(index: int) → ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶

Read a single block from the data file, at the given linear index.

Parameters:

index – Linear index of the block being read in the data file.

Returns:

N-dimensional array containing the spectrum

values within the block.

class bioshift.fileio.ucsf.UCSFSpectrumReader(path: Path)¶

Bases: SpectrumReader

classmethod can_read(path: Path) → bool¶

Used to determine whether a particular spectrum path can be read using a UCSFSpectrumReader.

Returns:

True if the provided path is a .ucsf file.

classmethod from_path(path: Path) → UCSFSpectrumReader¶

Creates an instance of UCSFSpectrumReader from a given path to a .ucsf file.

Returns:

Instance of UCSFSpectrumReader supplied with the path to the .ucsf file.

get_data()¶

Create a UCSFDataSource object for the new spectrum.

Returns:

UCSFDataSource object.

classmethod get_header_size(ndim: int)¶

Calculates the size of the header in the .ucsf binary file from the number of dimensions in the spectrum.

Returns:

Size of the header in bytes.

get_params()¶

Read the spectrum metadata from the .ucsf file header.

Returns:

SpectrumParams object.
